job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-25T17:28:13.000Z", "description": "

Digital Asset Coordinator / Vault

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Manage all Digital Assets on our Production servers and Physical Tape/Drive Assets in our vault.
  • Correspond with our internal post-supervisors about all incoming and outgoing digital assets, drives, or tapes.
  • Make sure all digital and physical assets are received and delivered securely according to our security procedures and policies.
  • Log the metadata of all incoming and outgoing digital files into our Digital Asset Management System.
  • Keep accurate and up-to-date logs of LTO Tape Archives.
  • Setup redundant or old unneeded assets for recycling or destruction.
  • Make sure vault is organized and physical asset inventory lists are current.
  • Correspond with outside clients about the deliveries of drives and Digital transfers (Aspera).
  • Some administrative duties may be required like filing documents, copying, archiving, and setting up deliveries.
  • Physical labor may be required with our physical assets in the vault. (up to 25 lbs)
  • Other duties as assigned


Qualifications:

  • Must have 2 - 4 years of experience working in A/V post-production environment.
  • Working Knowledge of Xytech or Digital Asset Management Software.
  • Knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook, and FileMaker Pro.
  • Experience working with many different types of data and video files.
  • Ability to multi-task in a high pressure, fast-paced post-production environment.
  • Must have a professional attitude and the ability to work cooperatively with co-workers.
  • Strong organization and communication skills with attention to detail.

 


We offer competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits program including medical, dental & vision coverage, vacation & sick leave, 401(k), and more.
